name: JD Edwards EnterpriseOne
description: Oracle JD Edwards EnterpriseOne is an enterprise resource planning software with primary features such as real estate management, human capital management, environmental health and safety and commodity trading. What is JD Edwards EnterpriseOne? JD Edwards EnterpriseOne is a cloud-based Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and supply chain management solution that provides ERP applications and tools for finance, consumer goods, human resources, distribution and manufacturing sectors. The system provides features such as financial management, project management, asset lifecycle management, order management, CRM, manufacturing, supply chain planning and logistics, reporting and business intelligence. How do you use JD Edwards EnterpriseOne?

pricing.general: Contact Oracle for detailed pricing information.

reviews.general_review: Unfortunately, I did not work with JD Edwards anymore, but it was a excellent ERP.
reviews.pros: In my opinion it is the best ERP in the market. I have worked with this ERP for more than twelve years, as a key user. It is flexible and easy to customize and has a good support. For Manufactirung module, I think it is the best.
reviews.cons: As it is easy to customize, when you need to update or upgrade the ERP, you have to spend more time testing.

reviews.general_review_title: JDE will make your AP process smoother than ever
reviews.general_review: My overall experience with JD Edwards can be described as a learning ride. JDE is not too user friendly or intuitive, but once you learn how to use it and all the codes necessary for the actions required for your AP Process, then you can start to take full advantage of all its possibilities. In my team we have been very benefited by the use of this tool and are currently using it on a daily basis. I would totally recommend it.
reviews.pros: All the information needed about a vendor is already in the system when a new vendor creation is done, so you do not have to worry about remembering what are the payment terms, or checking what is their bank account. You just have to check that the invoice in the system was correctly processed and then once the payment is ran, you will get all the information on when the invoice will be paid, or you can even change the Net Due Date so it can be paid earlier if it is a down payment.  Correction of payments is also very easy to do in JDE. You just have to create a PD (or cancellation document) for said payment and then create a new one with all the vendor information and change the items that were incorrectly booked, such as invoice amount, tax code, BU, among others. Then you just proceed to do the clearings so the action can be recorded in the books and done!
reviews.cons: One of the most important aspects for me is the ability to handle your vendor master data. Unfortunately for JDE this is not one of its brightest points. If the same vendor has changed their VAT and are now using a new one, or they changed their banking information, you cannot change it in the system, but you have to either create a new vendor with the new information, or duplicate the one existing and update the new items. This, sadly, takes quite some time (at least 48 hours), therefore impacting your payment process and generating delays.

reviews.general_review: We use it for manufacturing. We have a lot of modifications. I an creating a new system for the users right now - a commercial invoicing system with history, edit and reprint capability.
reviews.pros: Using it since 1993, It is like home. I can make it do anything. Oracle does a good job with support and creating new features and technologies.
reviews.cons: I wish more places use it. Oracle needs to market it better.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: The only positive remark I can make about JDE CMMS is that it will be going away at this location, Soon
reviews.cons: NOT user-friendly:  at other locations I have trained Production AND Maintenance personnel in the use of CMMS / work order entry very effectively.  From the most savvy computer users to old guy who didn't even know what a mouse was for.  JDE: like pulling teeth to get them to use the system at all because it is so difficult to learn and counter-intuitive to most users.   Not efficient:  First red flag I found in JDE was that it took more than 20 clicks / selections (at best - assuming ALL default selections could be accepted) to simply PRINT 1 Work Order.  While working thru that process, it was necessary to indicate, at least twice, (this is a computer folks, why would you be required to repeat the object to be printed. (First step- select the W/O, then about step 8 or 10 it had to be selected again.) This was eventually corrected to allow a SINGLE W/O to be printed in 2 clicks, but multiple selections still require these steps.  Not intuitive:  there are (or were) places in JDE where selecting a RED X is/was required to SAVE steps accomplished in a process.  This may have been changed to a green check or a disk in recent updates, but it still begs the question. ?WHY would ANY software make such a selection necessary?  EVER.?  Did I mention,... NOT Efficient:  using other (very effective) software, the old guy (as well as most anyone else) could enter the critical data for a Work order in under 30 seconds after maybe a couple weeks of use.  at this point, (9 years, 3 updates later) even I, the most experienced user on the CMMS System, cannot enter the data necessary to create a W/O in less than 3 minutes.  and it does not just work orders that consume valuable time.  most of the processes in JDE require so many repetitive actions, that it is sickening to watch some of the individuals perform their daily tasks from purchasing, inventory functions, etc. because so much time is wasted in the process.  and to top it all off, from early on (to present day) when I was observing some of the folks who work with me perform those daily tasks, I noticed them exiting the process, then returning to the process, as though they were double checking the entries.  when I inquired about this action / repeated steps, I was told that on occasion it was possible for you to "time-out" on your JDE access, and have absolutely Zero indication that had occurred.  so all of these folks had gotten in the habit of exiting then re-entering to verify the information did indeed get saved to the system.  I actually had a hard time believing this could happen, with no indication, until it happened to my co-worker who was working with me at the desk next to mine and I personally witnessed it.  (less than 6 months ago)

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: It's actually easier to use than QuickBooks.
reviews.cons: Need to update to correct typos of date automatically, so that it could avoid to fail payments.

name: OASIS
description: OASIS is a customizable ERP system for small to midsize companies. This system is customized to the company’s precise specifications and is used primarily in the retail, manufacturing, and professional services verticals. OASIS’ suite can be purchased all together as a single ERP solution, or conveniently as separate modules. It offers applications to help manage various aspect of your business, from human resources to customer relationship management to Business Intelligence. Some of these applications include standalone marketing and sales automation, financial accounting, supplier management, and more.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: Connect Oasis allows me to be aware of each of my projects in real time, as well as gather information about field conditions, analyze the plan, and finally execute the project until its completion, thus obtaining good results.
reviews.cons: It has a wide range of tools, which allows me to create successful projects, I recommend those who want to have control in their hands.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: The product has edits to help move through the program with correct and complete information.
reviews.cons: It is very time consuming, and many nurses procrastinate entering the data.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: We use OASIS as an informational system for our vehicle management system.
reviews.cons: It can be complex to navigate until you become familiar with its features

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: The software is relatively easy to navigate, and the support is great.
reviews.cons: To the best of my knowledge, it cannot be installed on a server.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: Easy to use tools. It can handle discounts automatically and quick menu changes.
reviews.cons: Cost of the tools and equipment. Also, IT suppoort periodically.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: It saves time and paper. Data can be entered and saved.
reviews.cons: It is very confusing to use. Isn't designed to use at remote location. Multiple versions of same forms but they cannot be used interchangeable. Lack of software support.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: I like the cost, and it is relatively easy to troubleshoot given its use.
reviews.cons: Not many people around here use it regularly, so getting insights into it is hard.

name: Sage 500
description: Sage 500 is a cloud-based ERP solution that offers companies tools for distribution and supply chain, manufacturing and accounting and finance. The ERP financials module offers users tools such as general ledger, accounts parable/receivable, cash management, purchase orders and more. The distribution and supply chain management offers inventory management, purchase orders, sales orders, payment processing, warehouse management and more.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: three way match is very easy for po based invoices
reviews.cons: Manual posting is difficult to track back

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: Ease of Use Low operating cost  Very robust, keeps running
reviews.cons: Little improvement in software Too many other competing products from parent company

name: Slingshot Enterprise Business Suite
description: The Slingshot Enterprise Business Suite is a web-based enterprise resource planning (ERP) software suite designed to serve mid-sized to large businesses. The system serves retail, distribution, manufacturing, financial services, pharmaceuticals, government, and other markets. The company touts its ease of customization and usability as key differentiators. Slingshot Enterprise Business Suite includes applications for sales order management, procurement and requisition management, inventory and supply chain management, and enterprise financial management. The product has the ability to integrate with a user’s existing business software systems. The system’s customization options enable it to address industry-specific or changing business needs and preferences.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: I like the flexibility of the software to adapt to our requirements (adding/removing fields, forms, workflows, etc.). The user interface is very friendly and easy to use. It's very scalable and has a cloud-based deployment. The company delivered on exactly what they said they would do.
reviews.cons: I cannot think of anything that I do not like. Everything went according to plan.

reviews.general_review: This is a very productive and easy to use product. I would recommend every small business to use this software and imply
reviews.pros: None
reviews.cons: None

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: This is a pretty standard CRM. Easy to use and helpful features offered but just not as integrative as some other similar softwares like Zoho
reviews.cons: Just lack of features and not a very good reporting system.

name: UNIT4 Financials
description: Unit4 Financials (formerly Coda Financials) is a cloud-based accounting and financial management solution for public sectors, real estate, education, professional service, financial services and wholesale providers. It includes general ledger, accounts payable and receivable, fixed assets, budgeting, project accounting and spend management. The solution is multi-lingual and multi-currency. Unit4 Financials enables organizations to automate financial processes and manage compliance as well as corporate governance. The solution uses real-time data to provide visibility into company’s financial position which further helps in decision making. It also offers revenue analysis, account reconciliation and statement processing.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: We like the development of new and added features over the years. It is also a fairly easy system to teach someone how to use and users can explore things on their own.
reviews.cons: It can be hard to get reports out of the system sometimes.

reviews.general_review_title: Unit4 is great for travel expenses - especially the app!
reviews.general_review: Overall, I'm a fan on Unit4. Their upgrade changed things for my workload and allowed me to be more efficient, timely, and error-free. Their upload process changes how I work with my supervisor's requests for travel expenses.
reviews.pros: We use Unit4 Financials for our expense reporting. They got a significant upgrade a year or so ago which made dramatic improvements to their app and web functioning. It is now very easy to use the app to take pictures of your expenses and upload them. Since I do expenses for my supervisor who travels A TON, she is able to upload her receipts and add a description. Unless the receipts come in an email, my workload has been significantly cut down. She was sending them to me by mail previously, which made the time on her end and on my financial team longer. The app improvement led to ease across my organization.
reviews.cons: You have to have someone on your end who is really diligent and skilled in their background processes to run this product on the back end. We have been flooded with errors and downtime when updates come out or when new employees come on board. I have been using it for years so I understand how it works but new employees don't necessarily like the functionality and have seen easier to use products.

reviews.general_review: Terrible!
reviews.pros: The software itself when it is working is user friendly and quick to pick up. Queries are easily run and results easy to manipulate once exported
reviews.cons: There are so many!  If you want automated payments you need to pay for a consultant to install that for you and pay for this as an additional. This comes standard with most software.  The customer service is abysmal! We have received quotes that were miles off and then once you sign up, you are informed that the cost is twice as much and so we decided to cancel the contract as it was no longer affordable. This lead to retaliation I would say from Unit 4, they no longer assisting with our queries  and demanding  payment for almost every little task even installing their own licenses!! Getting a response is nearly impossible, delays of 2 months are normal!

reviews.general_review: Overall, we are pleased with Unit4 Financials.  It has provided efficiencies to our financial reporting process.
reviews.pros: I love the element structure, and the ability to receive imports from our Insurance system.  It gives us the ability to sub-analyze and report in all the ways that are necessary and valuable to our company.
reviews.cons: We are currently stuck in Version 12.  For the past couple of months, we have been attempting to upgrade to Version 14.  However, that version of Unit 4 Financials is not compatible with the IBM system we are on.  It is concerning that this wasn't thoroughly tested and resolved before release, and the amount of time it is taking to remedy the situation is disappointing.

reviews.general_review: We have used Unit4Financials for 24 years so we are obviously happy with it
reviews.pros: Unit 4 Financials gives Finance users and Administrators an edge on other systems based on features and system design .   It is well written and designed and their support in A-1
reviews.cons: Some old features like maintaining Hierarchies need updating and may not be needed in today's design.  Also the Client Server piece was removed in version 14 and many AP users prefer that to the web and it does have functionality that the web version does not .  Feel free to contact me if needed for this

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: CODA Excel is great to use. You can create your own reports for virtually any purpose or format. We now do our journal entries at month-end using CODA Excel, and it has saved a good amount of time. Also, CODA is quick to respond to any issues or questions we may have.
reviews.cons: Most everything works great, but one thing that would be nice to have is the ability to see all error messages when posting a journal entry. We could have a 200 line entry full of errors, but we have to address each one line by line.  Being able to see all errors at once would greatly improve productivity when dealing with these kinds of entries.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: It is fairly intuitive and easy to use. They genuinely seem to care about customer feedback recently, but the last few years, that seemed to go away.
reviews.cons: I believe that the product is getting very complicated, especially on the back end, and CODA support themselves are having a hard time keeping up with it, particularly in the web version. Also, CODA seems to be charging for everything that is extra outside of the core product.

reviews.general_review_title: Unit 4 financials for the smaller business
reviews.general_review: Good for the price!
reviews.pros: I like that this software is easy to use.  It is best suited for a small business.   You can filter out the pieces that you need quite easily.
reviews.cons: You do have to know accounting as everything is not just "ill in the blank, like you would on a tax program.

name: Sage Intacct
description: Sage Intacct is a provider of cloud-based financial management and accounting software. Sage Intacct's software solution is suitable for small to midsize accounting firms and can provide financial reporting and operational insights as well as the ability to automate critical financial processes. Sage Intacct cloud financial management solution manages all core financials and provides professional services to help implement Sage Intacct software.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: None
reviews.cons: None

reviews.general_review_title: Decent ERP software for medium, medium-large companies
reviews.general_review: Hard to get used to in the beginning (I transitioned from QuickBooks), but as you get more and more used Intacct can be very resourceful and more powerful than other, more conventional ERP systems.
reviews.pros: All the features, and integration capacity with other software.
reviews.cons: Can be clunky and not user-friendly in not a seasoned user. Some add-on features (like FA modules) have a lot to desire in order to be useful.

reviews.general_review_title: The easiest accounting program I've ever used
reviews.general_review: With Sage Intacct's user-friendly interface, you won't have any trouble using it and getting the job done. For my accounting needs, I generally utilize Sage Intacct's reporting tools. These tools provide me a wide range of options for reporting and analysis, and the software's user-friendly design makes it easy for anybody to use.
reviews.pros: I like how well-organized the financial records are, as well as the automated payment schedules and reminders he sends to remind me of upcoming due dates. It features a better user interface than some of its rivals. Adoption was pushed by one of our staff members, and the system's users said they liked it.
reviews.cons: Sage Intacct is a great system in general, and I have no complaints. My time would be better spent if there were shortcuts. People who aren't familiar with accounting systems may have a hard time with the interface.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: There's some great aspects about Intacct. One of my favorites being that I can type in a formula in my DB/CR columns to calculate what numbers I should be posting. I haven't worked with a software yet that allowed me to do that. The bank recons are pretty easy and straight-forward. You can also set up very specific access permissions for an intern for example. Once you get the hang of the way it works, it really opens your eyes to how much you could really customize the software to your needs.
reviews.cons: It took a while getting used to the software. It's VERY finicky. There are definitely some aspects that could be improved.

reviews.general_review: My overall experience with Intacct is overall positive. Intacct does save me significant time and effort in my everyday tasks compared with our older software. i do feel it could be improved upon further to make it a better product.
reviews.pros: I like the fact that it is browser based through the cloud which makes access quick and easy. The modules that I use the most work very well such as Accounts Payable and Time and Expense. The General Ledger reporting function is very helpful and easy to use as well.
reviews.cons: There are a few modules such as Prepaids, Fixed assets and Purchasing that we had purchased after the initial implementation of intacct that did not work very well initially. There were many work arounds and technical problems that created alot of unneeded headaches and work. Fortunately this has been fixed now for the most part and works well.  Another issue I have is the support community that I put support tickets in when I need some help. They don't seem to know the product very well and often the solutions and advice I receive is partially right or wrong altogether. There have been instances where I have just figured it the problem myself through reading articles or experimenting with settings etc.

name: Sage 100
description: Sage 100 is a cloud-connected ERP platform (Enterprise Resource Planning) for medium-sized manufacturers, distributors, and professional service companies. Finance, budgeting, planning, inventory, supply chain, production management, reporting, and CRM are all part of the functional solution.

reviews.general_review_title: Good for small to medium business
reviews.general_review: It was a great overall experience and was simple enough for a smaller business to implement while still having the horsepower.
reviews.pros: Having worked with a few erps, this is one of the cleanest UIs and has been a great experience with getting data out of it. The datacubes on the backend have been really good as well. Order allocation is clean and simple and has warehousing plugins that work well too.
reviews.cons: I really wish that price breaks and price levels worked better. It was very difficult to get the accurate pricing inputted to the system.

reviews.general_review_title: Huge improvements over earlier Sage products
reviews.general_review: We've been able to greatly improve how our manufacturing processes across various locations are reflected in our budgets and accounting practices.  It's saved us thousands of hours per year in terms of extracting the data, manipulating it, and putting it back into Sage for final reporting. You can now do that within Sage 100.
reviews.pros: Our organization moved from Sage 50 to Sage 100 and wow, what a difference! We thought Sage was the issue, but really the business had just outgrown the more base version of the software.  Sage 100 can fully handle complex costing and processes present in a modern day manufacturing business.  It can collect data at various nodes in the process and roll them up for budgeting and forecasting.
reviews.cons: We use a lot of agile software platforms on our sales and ecommerce side of the business,  and Sage 100's API catalog doesn't really keep up with what's needed to move quickly in 2020.

reviews.general_review: I’ve been using this program for 7 years in my current position. I process driver payroll and billing in a trucking and warehousing company. We use it daily in my department. Everyone seems to like it okay.
reviews.pros: I like that you can save your favorites in one spot so you can easily get to the reports and functions you use frequently.  Everything is straight forward so it’s fairly easy to train new people on this program.
reviews.cons: I’ve had a lot of issues with if someone else is using the same area/module as you it doesn’t warn you it just tries to do what you want and then just force closes yours and tells you after the fact. And then you’re like what the heck where was I at in the process? So beware of that. Also connecting printers to this has been a total PITA on more than numerous occasions.

reviews.general_review_title: Fortunately this version has been upgraded
reviews.general_review: I work in the manufacturing industry, specifically a foundry in Chicago.  Several factors bias my experience with MAS90/Sage 100. I was introduced to the software with no training or reference guide because the woman before me left suddenly and without any documentation.  In a certain perspective that speaks well of this product in that simply by internet research and experimentation, as well as a few call to our highly paid "Sage" support line, I have been able to work with the system adequately.    I would love to upgrade to a new version of this Sage product and imagine that it is very likely a much cleaner and straight forward operating system   For instance, the difference between reversing a check and simply reversing the G/L transaction are two different procedures and a third procedure to void a check that has never been issued is a different procedure entirely from voiding a check that you have placed a stop payment on.  In a sense, these five distinctions would be ideal for a precise audit trail if the procedures themselves were not extremely complex and vague to distinguish.  The General Leger reports are clear and are in themselves user friendly in offering the opportunity to easily make accrued and adjusting entries.  I would certainly encourage anyone to investigate the newer versions of Sage in consideration of their industry specific needs.  We have not created a direct interface between our receivables data base "Exact" directly into MAS 90 due to the particular need to maintain specific Alloy/Customer information and our small company simply lacks the time and technical understanding to do so.  Again my situation is severely biased due to my particular circumstances and I believe a newer version of Sage may very likely be an excellent ERP.
reviews.pros: If I can figure out a highly antiquated version of their product without internal direction and assistance, I suspect the newer versions of Sage can only be fat superior.
reviews.cons: A complete mire of ambiguity when it comes to the Accounts Payable component in this ancient version by Sage:MAS 90

reviews.general_review: Sage 100 acts as the accounting system for our entire business.  It's great for small businesses like ours.
reviews.pros: We use Sage 100 for A/P, A/R, and G/L and those modules work great for our business.  The interface is simple to use and customizable so you can see only the fields that are important to you.  We've also built several import jobs to be able to import data from our other systems.
reviews.cons: My only complaint with Sage 100 is that it practically requires a third-party to help you implement and upgrade every so often.  I wish the upgrade process was more intuitive and better documented so that a third-party would not be necessary.

name: NetSuite
description: With an integrated system that includes ERP, financials, commerce, inventory management, HR, PSA, supply chain management, CRM and more – NetSuite enables fast-growing businesses across all industries to work more effectively by automating core processes and providing real-time insights into operational and financial performance. What is NetSuite?

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: None
reviews.cons: None

reviews.general_review_title: It is a great ERP but it is not for everyone
reviews.general_review: Accounting, Trasury. Reporting (but we ended up doing the reporting outside the ERP)
reviews.pros: Netsuite has a lot of potential when automating processes. It is a great ERP for big Companies or big startups.
reviews.cons: There is not much literature about netsuite or learning material. Because of this, you are trapped with Consultants. Sometimes you might get lucky but sometimes no. I had both experienceThe ERP is complex to implement. It has become popular in the startup world but it´s complexity does not make it ideal for everyone. Yes. the potential is great but you really need to do a good research before jumping to implement this ERP

reviews.general_review_title: Overall a great accounting software for medium-sized businesses
reviews.general_review: Overall switching to NetSuite transformed our Finance team from data entry people to auditors. With most menial tasks automated or semi-automated, it freed up more time to audit our data and be more proactive with our accounting in general. Revenue management, which used to be a 100% manual, line-by-line nightmare, is now almost fully automated. Human errors were greatly reduced. Our sales opening process is almost fully automated thanks to the seamless Salesforce integration. Overall we are very satisfied with our switch.
reviews.pros: The Revenue Management feature is amazing, a bit tricky to understand but once you get the hang of it it saves a ton of time.Multi-subsidiary and multi-currency work extremely well. We have 8 different subsidiaries in 3 currencies and it's made our lives so much easier to have them all in one place, with automatic currency conversion and automated end-of-month eliminations.Having automations like monthly postings to our GL, amortization calculations for our numerous IT purchases and monthly subscriptions, and the great reconciliation tool has saved us a ton of time during month's end.Integration with Salesforce was a breeze with an out-of-the-box connector.Support is generally very knowledgeable, problems are quickly fixed and answers quickly answered. There is a great Help tool (SuiteAnswers) where we find an answer to most of our problems, as well as a very active Enhancements Requests database.
reviews.cons: Some features lack flexibility, like revenue recognition posting, but there are workarounds.User adoption can be slow because the system is very different from most mainstream systems, with it being so automated.Sales taxes management for Canada isn't totally adapted since they replicated American functionalities with Canadian codes, but there are also workarounds to this.

reviews.general_review_title: Small Retail and Internet Businesses Beware
reviews.general_review: On paper things looked good.  Two years down the road and I am running the company by gut instinct and need to overview every order to make certain it is covered. Inventory is a mess. Projections are not available. And COGS are often zero. ACS is a ripoff- most jobs were not completed within a quarter- and we still have hours remaining. Job not done? Too bad.  Use ACS for install only and then bite the bullet after the first year.  Their hourly charges are ridiculous. I am uncertain if Netsuite even remotely cares about small accounts- this is an 80K program.  And it is costing us approx 200K yearly including lost revenue due to inventory, additional staff, and lost productivity. Language has been an issue.  Even our quote from netsuite for renewal has needed careful overview. Finally we were instructed by netsuite to hire an outside party to get the jobs done that someone else could do.  At $145 per hour.  Fingers crossed. Netsuite assumed zero responsibility for anything.  So, if you are a small business that is growing and changing reasonably quickly I would strongly urge you to seek another program. The program has kept our company dead in the water. For at least 18 months. My experience with Dynamics, which also has difficulties, was better with high functionality within 12 months.  Needless to say, we are signing the contract with Netsuite but will switch once it is expires and we are more prepared.  They simply do not provide adequate service to smaller businesses.
reviews.pros: I would assume it would be good if it worked. AS is the only functionality we have are additional integrations. Ones that cost 9K.
reviews.cons: Customer service is pretty awful. Jobs simply were not done. It was similar to playing the game telephone. While our rep is sympathetic they have little or no power to do anything.

reviews.general_review: Our move to Netsuite was very smooth and allowed for us to transition with no downtime. Support has been outstanding and the ability to customize ourselves has been invaluable as we continue to make it our own.
reviews.pros: NetSuite provided our once disjointed business with one single source of truth. All users now have access to an all around view of our customers making business decisions easier and allowing information to be readily available real time.
reviews.cons: The standard inventory module is very standard - while allowing for multiple warehouse locations, item/bin location reporting can be tricky to create without advanced module.

name: Sage 300cloud
description: Sage 300cloud (formerly Sage Accpac) is an enterprise resource planning (ERP) software system that serves small and medium-size businesses in professional services, financial services, public sector, and other markets such as distribution and wholesale. The system supports multinational business finance management, with support for multiple currencies and locations. Users can manage multiple companies with features to close books and report results by company or consolidated company.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: Standardization. We were doing a lot of process work through excel, word, email, etc. This forced us to standardize how we operated and gave our clients a consistent experience over multiple projects.  Job costing is capable of being more accurate than we need.
reviews.cons: Lack of significant improvements to the software given the annual support and maintenance amount paid. Features tend to be minor with more significant improvements coming in the form of additional optional products for purchase.

reviews.general_review: Overall the program is satisfactory.
reviews.pros: The modules are easy to use . The screens are easy to navigate and they are user friendly.  there is excellent audit tracing for each module.
reviews.cons: The reports are minimal. The more useful reports require you to purchase a separate license for Sage intelligence which is very expensive. the stock reports require another software program (Crystal reports ) in order to modify them. The set up screens for the customer and vendor screen do not allow for more than one email address which reduces the ability to email directly from Sage. The payroll module does not email EFT check reports to employees. You have to buy another program in order to do this (Print Boss). Overall there is a hefty price tag to purchase all the modules and add on programs to use. If you can stay with Simply, then you should.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: I started my business accounting using this software and quickly realized it had way more features than I needed for a sole proprietor. If you run a large organization with lots of employees you will probably utilize more of those functions.
reviews.cons: There's a huge learning curve, it's not intuitive, and it's very expensive. There are lots of accounting programs available that are easier to use and a lot more affordable (ex. Wave is free and gets the job done).

reviews.general_review_title: The work of SAGE 300 ERP with Me in Lusaka, Zambia
reviews.general_review: We were trying to address the issue of going green meaning working in a paperless environment.  We benefit in many ways as we had reduced on stationery cost, and work become faster as processes were integrated in the systems.  It still requires improvement and the environment in which it works does not fully support or become compatible with local Vendors.  The advice I would give to others is that they need careful planning so that they only ask for installation of packages suitable for their environment.
reviews.pros: It automates manual work of processing purchase orders and eliminates physical postage of paper documents to third party (Suppliers). It integrates separate pieces of transactions into one, making work easy and shorten the overall time spent on processing one simple transaction e.g. Purchase requisition is generated by someone else then converted into a purchase order without altering many details. The system is able to make basic or advanced calculations of cost and taxes hence eliminating the burden of errors and omissions.
reviews.cons: It is somehow expensive to run as it requires a perpetual subscription to be made. It is a system that cannot just be installed on the PC for a lifetime.  Room for improvement is still available because it has a lot of steps (clicking is too much).    We could not achieve the go-green aim as most of the time we were printing out physical copies of contracts as the environment in which we used the system did not have many vendors connected to the internet.

reviews.general_review_title: Sage300 and why you should use it
reviews.general_review: We use it as our basic accounting package for dealing with all of our vendors and all of our clients.
reviews.pros: It has all of the basic features of a full accounting system including AP, GL, AR, Sales order, Inventory mgmt.
reviews.cons: Customization is not simple to do. It is not simple to add new forms or understand the table structures. Table names are very short and obsure.

name: Planning Maestro
description: Centage’s Planning Maestro is a cloud-native planning & analytics platform that delivers year-round financial insight, transforming how companies budget, forecast and report performance. Centage delivers a level of sophisticated financial intelligence typically only enjoyed by large enterprises, at a price point accessible for SMBs. Leveraging this financial intelligence, Planning Maestro synchronizes the P&L, the balance sheet, and the cash flow to ensure GAAP compliance. This offers the users not just a short-term view of the company’s health, but a long term view of the financial health of a company.

reviews.general_review: The implementation of the product was smooth. The reporting capabilities of the program have exceeded my expectations. In addition, every person I've been in contact with at Centage has expert level knowledge of the program and any issues have been resolved immediately.
reviews.pros: The best part of this software are the drivers we use to manage our sales budget. We have several LLCs that are within this program. The ability to expand the way we create our budgets has given us greater insight into where we can save money.  The elimination of finding "human error" input in an excel budget has alleviated so much time.
reviews.cons: I have yet to find anything I don't like about this product.

reviews.general_review: Centage has been great to work with, from implementation to today, they have been a true partner on our budgeting and forecasting journey.  I've always been happy to recommend them and their software.
reviews.pros: Planning Maestro brought a platform that allowed us to integrate into our existing accounting platform and create a structured environment we could use to refine our budgeting and forecasting process.
reviews.cons: I don't have anything negative to say.  When I have run into issues with the software I have always reached out to Centage and we have found ways to incorporate what I need into the software.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: I do like the preview of the expense and how it will look like on the P&L. It really helps me make sure that my spread method is correct. I like analytics maestro. I can use excel to build reports. Also, it is easy to use the data to create charts and graphs and make the financial data consumable to those budget owners, who may not have a fiance background. I also like the ability to refresh and update the data quickly.
reviews.cons: Reporting. In analytics the idea of building is great, reminds me a salesforce. But it is sooooo slow on the virtual desktop. From what I understand this will continue to be the case in BM9.  Also the reporting within the software is slow as well. It takes anywhere from 1-3 minutes to run any report. Also, the inability to create a version and it to show up in all plans. For example, if we want to create version of our 3+9 Forecast

reviews.general_review_title: Great product for M&A focused roll-ups and disparate companies
reviews.general_review: Very pleased with how it has scaled for us as we grew from 6 locations to 55.
reviews.pros: Cloud-based and scalable as we built out the company organically and through M&A
reviews.cons: Some of the drivers are a bit tricky to understand.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: We needed a budgeting package that would be (1) easy to learn and use for our end-users, (2) able to automatically integrate with 3rd party general ledgers and (3) provide a powerful set of customizable analytics and reporting tools.   Planning Maestro has successfully met all three requirements, and allowed us to provide more accurate budgets/forecasts/reporting with faster turn around.
reviews.cons: A common issues I have with multiple software vendors: Enhancements and usability improvements can take a long time to roll out.

name: PlanGuru
description: PlanGuru is an on-premise business planning and budgeting solution for small businesses and nonprofits. The solution helps accountants to build financial forecasts, prepare budget analysis and address financial constraints of small businesses. PlanGuru offers a budgeting software which includes tools to create and manage income statements, balance sheets and cash flow statements. With more than 20 forecasting methods, businesses can analyze and forecast their financial requirements for any period up to 10 years.

reviews.general_review: I've been able to help my clients create future plans and look at many what if scenarios and their affect on the balance sheet without having to worry about whether my formulas are correct in excel.
reviews.pros: The flexibility of the application for creating multiple forecasts and budgets using a variety of assumptions and KPI's.  the use of excel to integrate and add additional flexibility to the program.  The subschedules allow multiple ways to forecast revenue and track other expenses.  the integration of the balance sheet and ability to see affect the forecast has on the balance sheet items.
reviews.cons: Some lack of flexibility in reporting.  Lack of ability to print reports from analytics.

reviews.general_review_title: Great value in cash flow planning
reviews.general_review: Overall a great cash flow program for the price. it has many features that programs 10 times the price do not have.
reviews.pros: Plan Guru is a straightforward application for generating cash flow statements. I have used the product since 2003, and have watched it evolve from a simple tool to a more sophisticated application. The company has been receptive to user requests such as increasing the size of database fields to allow larger numbers, adding supplementary schedules, and direct cash flow projections.    Some of the debt amortization wizards are very handy, providing current portion of LTD in addition to amortizing loan balances and interest charges.     They have also included some valuation and ratio analysis work papers that are very handy.    This is a small company (at least it operates as one) where you can actually talk to a real live person.    All in all, it is a very good application for the price.
reviews.cons: The application occasionally will show some instability, but this has been vastly improved over earlier versions. There are recovery routines so most of the data is not lost. The crashes seem mostly due to print driver compatabilities. The developers are pretty good at fixing these issues.    Large, complicated formulas may run into size limits when calculating dollar outcomes. When this occurs, I have created interim formulas in a workbook to get to the final formula.    It's nice that the application has supplementary schedules for the P&L. However there are no such supporting schedules for the balance sheet. Much of the work I do is in the balance sheet. It would nice to have a supporting schedule that would clean up the balance sheet presentation.    The learning curve can be a little steep for the novice user. The application was developed by CPAs for CPAs, although this application is valuable for private companies.

reviews.general_review_title: Good product but far from the ideal Forecasting software
reviews.general_review: Plan Guru is an excellent product, specially  considering that there are no products out there with this many features at this price level.  If you want to have the best products you will have to pay tens of thousands every year, ie. Budget Maestro.  However I think PG has some room for improvement, such as    1.- More flexibility in the automatization for the recording of Historical and actual values. Not even copy and paste is possible.  2.- Make it more friendly. PG can only be mastered by someone with a strong background in Finance  3.- Expand reporting capabilities and allow to export reports to excel with up the 36 months instead of only 12 mo.  4.- Develop a Mac version or a web version  5.- Develop Inventory module and allow for supporting schedule on the Balance sheet  6.- Flexibility in putting some values ( ie. interest expense) in the balance sheet for capitalization purposes
reviews.pros: -Once you have all the numbers, projections are very fast and exact.  -Income Statement, Balance Sheet and Cash flow integration  -Links to excel files
reviews.cons: - The link process is very long and tedious  - No possibility of using formulas in the actual and historical data  - Need an inventory module  - Need Supporting schedule for the Balance sheet

reviews.general_review_title: Solid product, Feature-Rich, Intuitive Design, Great value for small- to medium-sized businesses.
reviews.general_review: I am attempting to build budgets for my clients using the PlanGuru software installed on the remote cloud desktop.  Overall, the product has met my expectations.  I have used several similar large/deluxe budgeting tools built for Fortune 500 companies that cost 10 times as much (or more), and this is a very good "abridged" budgeting software for small businesses that is still very feature-rich.  The support I have received from the technical team has been very good; they have been very responsive to my requests.  The cloud desktop experience was a little bit more laggy than I expected.  I LOVE the Excel add-in.  It is a very powerful tool.  However, I thought the installation of the add-in was a little more complicated than it should be, especially based on the cost of the cloud subscription.  There is room for PlanGuru to improve a few things, but I will be using for future clients, and I highly recommend this product for small- to medium-sized businesses.
reviews.pros: Very intuitive design.  Most features/functions are just a right-click away.  If you don't understand exactly what you are looking at, the tutorial videos are GREAT, and they have links to the relevant videos built right into the program where you need them.  Excel Add-in is a very powerful tool.  A real selling-point for PlanGuru.  If you know how to use a pivot table, you will love this tool.  Consolidations.  If you have multiple departments, or groups of departments, consolidations is a must-have.  Excel Links.  If the myriad of PlanGuru projection methods aren't good enough, just suck in whatever data you want from Excel to the budgeting tool.
reviews.cons: It would be great if this product was built as a web/browser-based product, rather than a local client install.  Then the users could also save on the cost of the remote cloud desktop, and installation/connectivity should be easier.  There should really be a "mass-refresh" button/method in the Excel add-in that would refresh every tab at once.  A "mass-consolidation" button in the PlanGuru application would be nice, too.  I wish there was a "help forum" where users could assist one another and help troubleshoot issues.  Support is responsive, and the videos are great.  But support can't answer you as fast as a forum search would, and the videos don't cover everything.  Chances are SOMEONE has had the same question in the past.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: It is easy to use. It is the only product in the market that I am aware of that focuses on the balance sheet and in particular cash.
reviews.cons: Reporting features could be enhanced. Would like to be able to hide accounts that are no longer in use. When reporting condense some categories while expanding others.

name: Flexi Software
description: Flexi’s accounting software for business is ideal for companies seeking an enterprise-strength platform, but with the flexibility and personalized support rarely offered by enterprise vendors. Flexi’s solutions have been battle-tested for over 30 years, powering leading brands around the world in industries like banking, insurance, and healthcare where security and performance are paramount. Flexi Software is ideal for complex accounting environments, with features that enable: •Multi-entity consolidation •Multi-book accounting •Daily close capabilities •Built-in compliance and audit controls •Workflow automation •Global currency conversion •Real-time, advanced reporting •Integration with any third-party system

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: This software is really paying for itself.  I have never owned a more flexible sign making software.  The design help that is offered is unsurpassed.  I encourage anyone looking for a creative, design solution for their signs to purchase this product!
reviews.cons: None

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: This software is very helpful for those company who are running their ads and campaign.  Making signage is very tedious work especially in signing and design.
reviews.cons: Check the integration and compatibility of your existing printing machinery before planning to purchase. Make sure to talk and ask your local partner.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: I guess this software would be the answer to every accounting personel's problem. As this will make their life easier. This will push them to bid goodbye to manual generation of reports because it offers real-time visibility of audit trails and financial reports.
reviews.cons: Contrary on the name of this software, flexi, this is a not so flexible software for everyone. Because this will only be compatible for companies which focuses more on accounting-based services.

reviews.general_review_title: Easy to use and easy to navigate
reviews.general_review: Great product with exceptional navigation. People friendly for all to use!!
reviews.pros: very easy to use, people friendly product
reviews.cons: n/A

reviews.general_review: This software is excellent and helped my organization.
reviews.pros: The functionality is awesome!
reviews.cons: No cons

name: Multiview ERP
description: Multiview Financials is the flagship ERP system developed, sold, implemented, and supported by Multiview Financial Software. Multiview is designed for organizations ranging in size from rapidly growing small businesses to large enterprises across North America.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: This product has greatly improved my work flow and enjoyment. Features I like best include the search options that can be performed on a multitude of items such as an amount, invoice number, key word, etc. Another great feature is the easy functionality of customizable pivot tables. The customer service I have received has also been incredibly remarkable. Timely answers and solutions to any problems encountered have added to my appreciation of this wonderful product.
reviews.cons: I feel certain that this software has fantastic functionality that I have yet to learn. I have been unable to attend a user meeting as traveling to Canada is difficult and costly from Texas.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: Browser based application eliminating the need for messy local installations and roll-outs to end users.
reviews.cons: Creating custom reports can sometimes be confusing and difficult, but the support for building these reports often makes up.

reviews.general_review_title: Multiview - In Implementation currently we have not hit any markers
reviews.general_review: Initially the sales pitch was a bit pushy to purchase on a quarter ending.  In hindsight that was due to a sales person knowing they were leaving {they left}, but the company made good on their initial items.  The implementation team did not address properly our 4 items that were critical for our needs.  Approx 12 months later our business analyst wrote up a quick 2 to 4 page document for them and reshared documents we provided their staff in the first couple of months of the project.    It appears that "yes" was the answer to can we do it.  However they did not vet that "yes" properly.   Their service overall was fine, main person kept pushing off the key items for "later" which is normally a red flag.  They asked if we would go live without those items and we declined for a # of reasons.    Later they asked if we would consider paying some additional cost to achieve them; we initially said no; then said we would if this would finalize it. {They set the offer on that}.   The Virus then hit; and was then told that we might need 10x's that initial offer they set.  We obviously said that is not reasonable.    For us the jury is still out on whether or not they will make good.   Their system appears to be good for all the basic accounting items; it is a bit large to configure but base system is good.   At this point the ball is in their court to finalize what was promised.  We are optimistic that they will do that.  The needs we have are industry specific not our company.  TBD
reviews.pros: Promised scalability Promised dynamic report Promised solution a few issues we have with "general" accounting software
reviews.cons: Implementation time has not been met Lack of communication over some of the solutions to the problems Different people brought in on the project that are new and lack the understanding The managing of the key items, waiting and then the back and forth on how.    We can't finalize the final con's til this is done but we will post again then.    We believe they will step up, it is trying times but everyone is in this together.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: Purchasing a new accounting software can be a little intimidating.  The staff at Multiview made the experience painless and left our accounting staff feeling confident in our decision.  Everyone we talked to had extensive knowledge of accounting.  Our sales contact was also a member of the implementation team prior to changing roles so she was able to answer all of our questions!!  The software had everything we were looking for and there was no additional programming needed to accommodate our needs.
reviews.cons: No complaints so far! It has been a lot of work but the staff has helped us along the way.

reviews.general_review: Obtaining customizable reports.
reviews.pros: It is highly customizable and able to suit the specific nuances of our business.  Features I like best include the search options that can be performed on a multitude of items such as an amount, invoice number, key word, etc
reviews.cons: It can be a little glitchy at times, but this isn't a big deal because customer support is able to resolve issues right away.

reviews.general_review_title: Multiview is excellent choice for Accounting software partners
reviews.general_review: Our selection of Multiview 4 years ago was an excellent decision for us.   They have a superior product, and expert staff who implement it.  The implementation process was a good experience.  Since we have been operating on Multiview now for quite some now, the excellent first impression, has only grown.  The upgrades to the software are valuable, and developed through thoughtful listening and feedback from users.  Upgrades are true and measurable improvements for the user.   The staff are responsive, and fun to work with.  Most of all, I enjoy working in Multiview every day, all day.  5 stars!
reviews.pros: None
reviews.cons: None

reviews.general_review: I have worked with Multiview software for over 15 years and have never been disappointed in the product or the service. Multiview provides a quality product for an extremely affordable price. The product is very customizable and Multiview has always found a way to intergrate with our in house systems to aid in our business solutions.  The customer service is by far the best I have ever encountered. The customer support team is responsive, knowledgeable, and timely. They listen to the needs of the customer and provide quality responses. I would highly recommend Multiview Financial Software.
reviews.pros: None
reviews.cons: None

reviews.general_review: I would like to go for the support team.
reviews.pros: Good financial solutions provider. Web-based application eliminating the need for complex local set up and roll-outs to users.
reviews.cons: They could make it easier for the user so that users don't need to go to the support team but the support team can handle it.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: The basics are relatively easy to figure out without much guidance, but anything more involved often requires an outside consultant.
reviews.cons: Setup is very involved and difficult, however, if it is done right, it is easy to navigate through.  Setting up security is somewhat complicated, but doable.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: It is highly customizable and able to suit the specific nuances of our business.
reviews.cons: It can be a little glitchy at times, but this isn't a big deal because customer support is able to resolve issues right away.

name: Cloud ERP
description: Bizautomation offers cloud-based ERP for smaller SMBs. Functionality includes accounting, order management, inventory, customer relationship management (CRM), sales commissions, e-commerce (including a business portal), purchase planning, and project management. Bizautomation Cloud ERP is primarily designed for smaller wholesalers / distributors, retail businesses and organizations with simple manufacturing needs. The software is priced on a per-user, per-month basis.

pricing.general: $79.95 per user / month (5-pack to start. Add single users as needed.)

reviews.general_review_title: Moving to BizAutomation from QuickBooks Enterprise was a leap of faith necessary for growth!
reviews.general_review: Ability to customize data input so that we can extract and parse to use in forecasting and planning
reviews.pros: Without a doubt the best feature of this software is the attention we got from the actual employees of the company, including some actual source code enhancements, that would never have happened at a big software company. We new that we needed to move from QuickBooks and could not afford some of the bigger players in the market, so we took a leap of faith based on what we saw as potential from BizAutomation. As with all software implementation - our move was not without some pain, but we truly appreciate the willingness of the company to take the time to listen to our needs and make improvements and modifications based on our business practice.  We believe that Biz is the right system to provide the organization, information and access of information we need for our company to continue to grow
reviews.cons: The company is small and does not offer 24/7 customer support - but that said, they are very accessible and willing to do what is necessary even in "off-hours"

reviews.general_review_title: Perfect Solution for an SMB. Has the right features and functions with the right price!
reviews.general_review: You get a very strong and modern true cloud ERP solution for a fraction of the cost of NetSuite, Acumatica, SAP Business One or Sage
reviews.pros: The user interface is nice and modern, coupled with a customizable dashboard. Strong accounting, solid inventory control, great E-commerce and decent CRM. This solution hits the sweet spot for SMBs. Either they are outgrowing their current Quickbooks integrated with multiple other software solutions to get something similar to an ERP or those businesses have a ERP and that ERP is way too much for where they are at. The price is really high, and have more functions and features than they need.    BizAutomation is perfect for those that are caught in between!
reviews.cons: It is a young software and has not matured yet, so in time these "least" comments will be addressed in the near future.    If you have any proprietary software or other platforms that will be integrated, chances are it has not been done. Expect customization (not nearly as costly as you think). Reporting is not their strong suit and have been told they are working on an upgrade. Not for businesses that have subsidiaries, although that too is being added.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: This CRM is ok for a small organization where you want to keep things in one plate and manage everything with one platform. As there are majority of requirements available in one place, integration became easy. With this a small company can manage Majority of tasks related to Accounting, Sales, Inventory management etc. as well as can view reports.
reviews.cons: Kind of a old fashioned interface for which sometimes it feels complicated. Also based on now a days different software, it could be more clean as most of softwares are.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: The Biz team worked hard to understand the different needs of our international company with multiple warehouse locations.  We were able to integrate a stock transfer program that was not part of the software initially that works great for us and our customers.
reviews.cons: When we found there was something missing or something that we felt could be improved for our particular business we brought it up with the Biz Team.  They worked with us to come up with solutions.

reviews.general_review_title: Comprehensive solution from a Small-Tech ERP company
reviews.general_review: As you'd expect from my glowing overview, I'm quite pleased, and of course, recommend this to any larger small business. Fair warning - If you're not growing or most of your employees are Tech Luddites, stay with Excel (In which you likely have bigger problems than ERP software).
reviews.pros: What I liked most is how flexible they were during the implementation process. One of my biggest complaints in dealing with Big-Tech ERP (no names to protect the guilty) is how everything gets nickel and dimed after the contract is signed, and money is exchanged. Sure, I'm not the one writing the checks, but I feel for clients in this predicament. Not the case here.
reviews.cons: The only thing I can think of is that like any solution this powerful, it takes time to get to know the ins and outs of the suite. The payoff is worth it, however.

name: CCH Tagetik
description: CCH Tagetik is a unified BI and accounting software that helps to optimize financial and operational planning. The solution also shortens the consolidation and closing process and allows users to analyze results, model, as well as compare the financial impact of different business scenarios. CCH Tagetik offers additional features which include adjusting strategic plans, updating rolling forecasts and producing formatted and auditable financial statements as well as management reports. The solution allows users to collaborate on business reviews and automates disclosure and board reporting.

pricing.general: Contact Wolters Kluwer for pricing information or a quote

reviews.general_review: We choose  tagetik some years ago for consolidation.  the year after we started a new project for budgeting  then planning...  every  project was a success
reviews.pros: It's a tip to a better way of working  saving time to perform better
reviews.cons: Our consultant from the beginning is the same person, we know each other and we work as we are colleagues

reviews.general_review_title: Impressive system to handle close, consolidations, and planning
reviews.general_review: We use CCH Tagetik for financial close, consolidations, financial reporting, other management reporting, and budgeting/planning/forecasting. Some of our planning uses include revenue modeling, wage modeling, asset planning, cash flow forecasting, and allocations. CCH Tagetik can do so much and is easy to use, so our users and administrators are always eager to do more with it.
reviews.pros: The system is extremely easy to use for technical and non-technical personnel. The system also has a wide range of out of the box features to get started right away, while also being extremely flexible in case you want to scale the product with your business.
reviews.cons: The product is generally extremely intuitive for the portions that a customer would use or be familiar with. That being said, new developments should be promoted more, in order for customers to keep up with the system and take advantage of the changes.

reviews.general_review: positiva
reviews.pros: L'utente con cui lavoro risulta soddisfatto del prodotto e delle sue funzionalità
reviews.cons: per il momento non ho riscontrato dei problemi

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: It's very flexible and is easy to integrate with other software programs and the interfacing process is seamless.
reviews.cons: It's overly complex at times, some parts of the software are difficult to understand and administer because it can do so much.

reviews.general_review: I've used Tagetik for 3 years now and I find it to be a very flexible system, it's at times too complex because it offers so much. It is very reliable and the data structure is relatively easy to understand. It is also a pretty seamless integrating Tagetik with other software using one of the many standardized ETLs.
reviews.pros: Can cater for pretty much any scenario with new features being added all the time.  Newer versions of the software are very impressive, some of the additions i.e. Tagetik data analytics look amazing.  They offer a lot of support through a Tagetik community and Tagetik Insiders. The social community is growing very fast.
reviews.cons: Some parts of the system, in particular, the native Excel reporting is difficult to understand.  It is quite expensive.

name: Sage Fixed Assets
description: Sage Fixed Assets delivers the most comprehensive fixed asset management solution offering 4 modules to allow businesses total control of their assets. From before they become fixed assets through the depreciation cycle and disposal at end of life, Sage Fixed Assets allows you to manage your entire fixed assets lifecycle.

reviews.general_review: Our company uses Sage Fixed Assets to maintain our company Asset files by setting up a separate company for each location.  Sage keeps up with the ever changing depreciation laws so you don't have to.
reviews.pros: Multiple companies can be set up, in addition a consolidated company can be set up for reporting purposes.  Lots of easy applications.
reviews.cons: When printing reports sometimes the system locks up on me and I have to log out and restart it.

reviews.general_review_title: Sage Accounting Software Can be improved
reviews.general_review: The program is great and it does what we need - the only thing bad about it is when there are upgrades there is always a glitch which is fixed when the next upgrade is released. Also the customer service can be improved - they place you on hold it seems like forever.
reviews.pros: it does do the statements and reports that we need and it does let you customize your reports
reviews.cons: the customer service - it takes forever to reach someone. When there are updates there is always something wrong with some aspect and you have to wait until the next update is released,

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: Sage fixed assets has the capability to add and track several data points, which can be customized by the company. Photos and notes for each asset can be added to the asset file and retrieved at any time.
reviews.cons: Certain data cannot be added to the main view grid, but can be added to reports, and vice versa. It's difficult to compare two different reports that pull two different sets of data because some data points are only added to one report versus another.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: Sage Fixed Assets has been able to fulfill all needs I've had while tracking multiple companies fixed assets. The interface and reports are well laid out. Customer Service team has been very helpful.
reviews.cons: It does become very slow as a large amount of assets are added to a database. Some changes to individual assets trigger other changes without alerting the user - such as changing depreciation type can change estimated life.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: It is a very straightforward to use, no complicated method to run and understand. Can store data for more than 10  years. I personally like using it
reviews.cons: The most concerning thing is it us only for fixed assets. Ignores other aspects of accounting.

reviews.general_review_title: The fixed asses management tool that you should definitely try
reviews.general_review: We use Asset4000 mainly for our asset tracking. Asset4000 have lived up to our expectations.
reviews.pros: Can work on Mobile/web seamlessly Integration with  Timely support: Customer support is really good.
reviews.cons: Initially it will take some time to explore the interface. This is something that I have face. Nothing as a disadvantage.

reviews.general_review: Implementing this software has made reconciling the sub ledger to the general ledger extremely simple. It also allows me to generate rollforward style reports automatically, which will make audits very simple.
reviews.pros: A lot of customizable reports, and the canned reports are very well designed. Once you've mastered the overall process, this system is a breeze to use. You can set up RAM to spit out functional journal entry uploads based on your ERP systems' needs, or if you use Intacct, it can directly interface with that ERP and do the upload for you automatically.
reviews.cons: They have not done much work to make the interface very user friendly for today's "standard" users, but if you are used to the older Windows style of program layouts, this will feels like home.

reviews.general_review: None
reviews.pros: It was a little difficult to view the product as the links that were sent required me to register for a full demonstration.
reviews.cons: It was a little difficult to view the product as the links that were sent required me to register for a full demonstration.

reviews.general_review_title: Easy to use, great user support
reviews.general_review: We've been using Real Asset Management's fixed asset software for around 10 years.  Their approach to customer service is second to none.  I haven't ever had problems contacting support for help.  Always contactable and no "press 1 for sales"...
reviews.pros: It's easy to use and very logical.  Once you get the idea of where to find things, everything fits into the same format  So you don't have to learn different ways to solve different problems.
reviews.cons: It does look a little old fashioned, maybe needs a face lift to bring it into the teenies.  It has a graphical interface, yet you're still unable to drag and drop things to save you from having to type the same things again and again.

reviews.general_review_title: Customer service that can ease any situation
reviews.general_review: I have had nothing but positive experiences with Asset4000. I was thrown into using this program with no real training on what to do and what the software could do. Every time I have called support they have always been helpful. They walk me through how to do things, while never getting frustrated. I love that I get the same 2-3 people who help me. You are never thrown into a que of a large call center. The people you talk to always know your name and your industry and act accordingly.
reviews.pros: It is very user friendly and any error made can be reversed and corrected easily.
reviews.cons: Length of time it takes for reports to process

name: Bassets eDepreciation
description: eDepreciation by Bassets is an on-premise fixed asset depreciation solution designed for midsize and large businesses. It caters to multiple market segments, such as banking and mortgage, distribution, health care, insurance, pharmaceuticals, retail, manufacturing, IT and transportation. eDepreciation supports different methods of depreciation calculation, such as MARCS, Alternative MARCS, Declining Balance Depreciation and Straight Line Depreciation. The product also assists in fixed asset calculation using different considerations, such as MACRS - 40% Rule Violation, Section 179 Deduction, Adjustment to Basis and Luxury Auto and Truck Limitations.

reviews.general_review: As someone with little depreciation experience before using Bassets, [SENSITIVE CONTENT HIDDEN] has been a great help in learning the software. He's always willing to walk through the steps to complete tasks.
reviews.pros: Reports for different schedules - IRS, Book, State - are so easy to run and switch between. Good import/export features to add new assets or pull reports out to excel.
reviews.cons: I wish there were some on-demand tutorials for common tasks.

reviews.general_review: Overall experience is satisfying.  [SENSITIVE CONTENT HIDDEN] is always willing to help and explain the problems
reviews.pros: easy to use, reports, able to add scanned documents, customer support ([SENSITIVE CONTENT HIDDEN])
reviews.cons: no "save " option, if you start entering something and want to back up, asset # is deleted

reviews.general_review: I needed customer support to help me figure out how to backup my database, and how to use the import feature to record current year additions.  The help I received was excellent.  I was quickly connected with a technical expert who worked with me to expediently resolve my problems.  A++
reviews.pros: None
reviews.cons: None

name: Fixed Assets Manager
description: Fixed Assets Manager by Red Moon Solutions is an asset management solution designed to support the businesses' internal tax practices. Fixed Assets Manager offers organizations in various industries, functionalities to track their fixed assets and ensure that the assets have up-to-date tax depreciation schedule. The solution provides a variety of depreciation templates, called Asset Types, as well as the ability to quickly create new assets. Also pre-defined in the solution are all the depreciation rules necessary to accurately calculate depreciation for Federal, ACE, AMT, accounting and any number of user-defined books.

reviews.general_review: You NEED a Fixed Assets software to track assets esp. when there's Lots of assets Need the reporting function that categorizes assets to certain groupings like chart of assets or property section
reviews.pros: Exports to Intuit's ProSeries Tax software Categorization of assets to certain groups with reports available Can be used as a Stand Alone Fixed Asset software Relatively simple to use
reviews.cons: MUST be used and UPDATED annually as needed Time-consuming to enter and to customize reports Can't print a report just for any 1 particular asset Must buy EACH year's software to import to EACH year's ProSeries Tax software to link properly Don't group assets together or else it WILL be a problem when assets in the group gets 'disposed of/sold' (i.e. Don't groups vehicles 1-5 or equipment 1-5 together but list separated as each can be disposed of/sold)! NAME the assets properly so it CAN BE TRACKED to the Actual physical asset (i.e. don't just say Computer when the office has Lots of computers)! Annual cost is rising! Basic file functionality is LIMITED (i.e. copy or rename files)!

reviews.general_review_title: Intuit's Fixed Asset Manager can be used as Stand-alone or part of tax software
reviews.general_review: Fixed Assets programs are a NECESSITY for tax professionals as any who REFUSE to use one or refuse to update their client's fixed assets are scammers who hurt their clients with overpriced fees!  Use the program to track assets, especially if there's LOTS of assets. Forget using spreadsheets where many people just use the straight line depreciation and must calculate it MANUALLY which kills the efficiency and relative accuracy since you may mess up the depreciation/amortization if one does NOT pay attention to calculate them properly. Penny wise, pound foolish!! It's best used either for financial reporting (tax/book differences, if any) and Better if used with the related tax software as it NEEDS to be updated YEARLY for EACH tax year's program or else it will NOT 'link'! You can categorize the assets to be each for internal reporting (i.e. in QBs) but it MUST be done ANNUALLY so the records match one another.
reviews.pros: Relatively simple to use MUST have program to track assets esp. if there's LOTS of assets Can categorize assets to different listings (i.e. if you maintain separate property or groups with different fixed assets for them) Decent reporting Exports file for import into Intuit's ProSeries Can be used for a few years before needing the latest upgrade, provided you use it as a 'stand-alone' program.
reviews.cons: A Necessity to buy Yearly if you use ProSeries business since you'll need to import the information Don't need if you do NOT perform any Financial reporting as you can enter asset info in the tax return's depreciation section Relatively expensive for just a Fixed Assets software Intuit began to limit the use of the software to <2 years before you have to 're-license' it! Many [OLDer] accountants refuse to update their clients' fixed assets then complain about it and Still do NOT fix them! Must buy YEARLY to match tax software for 'link' to work!

name: Up Your Cash Flow
description: Up Your Cash Flow is an on-premise budgeting and cash flow forecasting solution for small and mid-sized businesses. It is designed to help the CPA’s, CFOs, controllers and consultants to perform financial analysis and create cash management strategies. Primary features include sales analysis and management, expense management, business valuation, sales tax payment and collection..

reviews.general_review: I've been a user of the software for several years now and I really love it.  I run a virtual accounting firm and serve clients all over the United States. All of my clients need a budget and cash flow projection, especially in today's economy. I used to try and use Excel but it was too error prone. Up YourCashFlow is a solid tool with a ton of features that allow either a quick analysis, or a drilled-down detailed breakdown. Their training and support is top-notch too. I would recommend Up Your Cash Flow as an easy to use, yet very sophisticated tool for helping clients with forecasting and cash flow projections.
reviews.pros: None
reviews.cons: None

reviews.general_review: Up Your Cash Flow is the only software that I’ve found that is capable of producing an accurate cash flow forecast by project. Since we complete a few hundred projects per year, I organized my jobs by customer and used pivot tables to give me the data needed to post to UYCF. The software did the rest, and I was able to create a cash flow,  balance sheet and income statement with ease.     Way to go Up Your Cash Flow!
reviews.pros: None
reviews.cons: None
